item.title: Chardonnay Ritratti 2006, La-Vis, Trentino (Italiy)
item.description: The Chardonnay vine came to Trentino a century ago, found in our region its ideal habitat and is now the most cultivated white vine in the area. The Chardonnay “Ritratti” is cultivated in the hillside vineyards of Pressano and Lavis according to the principles of the “Quality Project”.

item.title: Gewürztraminer 2002, Marcel Deiss, Alsace (France)
item.description: Intensive golden yellow color and oily texture. The bouquet is developt and shows a complex flavor of quince, honey, try fig, exotic litschee and a hint of wet stones. Sweet wine. In the mouth the Gewürztraminer 2002 by Marcel Deiss shows sweetness and high density. The finish is long and ends minerally and even dry.

item.title: Chianti Classico 2005 Villa Cafaggio, Tuscany (Italy)
item.description: Chianti Classico ist a wine, which is procuced in the tuscan Chianti Classico area. Formerly Chianti Classico had to produced as a mix of different grape varieties. Today the wine law allows to use only Sangiovese grapes. Sangiovese possesess a thin skin. The Chianti Classico shows usually not to much tannins. Instead we find an nice acid.

item.title: Position and Future of Valdepenas (Spain).
item.description: A couple of years ago I visited Valdepanas joining a group of German wine journalists. I met Steve Cook. Steve was (and sometimes is) the exportmanager of Felix Solis. Felix Solis it the leading wineproducer in Valdepenas. Steve Cook told me something about his winecareer. We talked about the future of Valdepenas and also the differences between the winemarketing of the New World and Europe.
